title: Middle School Math: Ratios and Proportions
subject: Mathematics

questions.text: What is the ratio of 15 to 25 in simplest form?
A recipe calls for 2 cups of flour for every 3 cups of sugar. If you use 6 cups of flour, how many cups of sugar do you need?
A map has a scale of 1 inch = 50 miles. Two cities are 3.5 inches apart on the map. How many miles apart are the two cities?
Which of the following represents a proportional relationship?
If 4 notebooks cost $6.00, what is the unit price per notebook?
questions.rubric_hint: Divide $6.00 by 4 to find the unit price.

questions.text: A car travels 180 miles in 3 hours. At the same rate, how far will it travel in 5 hours?
In a class of 30 students, the ratio of boys to girls is 2:3. How many girls are in the class?
Explain what it means for two quantities to be in a proportional relationship.
questions.expected_answer: Two quantities are proportional when they maintain a constant ratio or rate as they change together.
questions.rubric_hint: Look for mention of constant ratio, rate, or multiplicative relationship.

metadata.description: An 8-question mixed-format assessment on ratios and proportions. Includes multiple choice and short answer questions aligned to Common Core standards.
